722729f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722729f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to 90th Streets. This is the old Bishop Potter Residence, which has been demolished, and a large
apartment house now occupies the site.
About 1925.
Brown Brothers.

722727f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722727f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, at the S.E. corner of 89th Street, showing the
residence of a Schulte.
1925.
Neg.~2E2

722728f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722728f-a.text:
89th Street, at the N.E. corner of Riverside Drive, showing the
Bishop Potter Residence.
About 1920.

722730f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722730f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to and including 90th Streets, showing the Bishop Potter Residence.
About 1912.

722732f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722732f-a.text:
Riverside Drive, east side, from 89th to and including 90th Streets, showing the Bishop Potter Residence.
About 1912.

722903f-a.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722903f-a.text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 93rd Street, showing the Columbia Yacht Club, viewed from the Drive. In the foreground are the New York Central Railroad tracks which will uisappear from view after completion of
the West Side Inproveent Project.
Note the U. S. Naval ships silhouetted against the Palisades on the Jersey shore. No. 2 is the same site during the aforementioned construction period.
View 1: June 17, 1936
View 2: June 28, 1935
P. L. Sperr

722903f-b.title: Manhattan: Riverside Drive - 89th Street
722903f-b.text:
Riverside Park, at the foot of West 93rd Street, showing the Columbia Yacht Club, viewed from the Drive. In the foreground are the New York Central Railroad tracks which will uisappear from view after completion of
the West Side Inproveent Project.
Note the U. S. Naval ships silhouetted against the Palisades on the Jersey shore. No. 2 is the same site during the aforementioned construction period.
View 1: June 17, 1936
View 2: June 28, 1935
P. L. Sperr
